_header: God that is so full of might
Note: For a later recension see 2921; for other versions, see 524, 4742.
_description: ‘Owayne Miles’ (couplet version), a version of St. Patrick’s Purgatory — 342 lines in couplets

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
God þat ys so full of myghtThat mendede wronge & made
                    Ryght…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…To þat blysse he vs bryngeThat of all ys lorde &
                    kynge
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Owayne myles (upper margin, f. 91v, and as RT thereafter on
                    verso leaves only); Explicit Owayne (after last line on f. 95rb); A
                    poeme intitled Gwaine miles (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of contents)
BlCottCalAII.Editions:
Kölbing,  Eugen. 
             “Zwei mittelenglische bearbeitungen der sage von St. Patrick’s
                purgatorium.” 
             Englische Studien
         1 (1877): 57-121: 113-21.
Easting,  Robert. 
             St Patrick’s Purgatory: two versions of Owayne Miles and the
                Vision of William of Stranton together with the long text of the Tractatus de
                purgatorio Sancti Patrici.
         EETS o.s. 298 (1991).

BodEngPoetd208.First Lines:
It spak of euery maner gospelOf heuene of herthe and of
                    hel…
BodEngPoetd208.Last Lines: …Bryng us to þat halleAnd hys modyr Marie
BodEngPoetd208.Editions:
Easting,  Robert. 
             “St Patrick’s Purgatory: Fragments of a Second Copy of the Middle
                English Stanzaic Owain Miles.” 
             Medium Aevum
         75 (2006): 84-102: 89-100.
